turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of Chaotic Trading Card Game.
turn.1: What was the first version of the Chaotic Trading Card Game?
turn.2: History of Chaotic Trading Card Game Before its current form the Chaotic Trading Card Game had several names and versions.
turn.3: What kind of materials were used to make the first version?
turn.4: Starting in Denmark, "Dracco Heads" was a children's collectors product featuring plastic figurines of strange creatures.
turn.5: Was there a second version of the game?
turn.6: In 2000 a trading card game called "Grolls & Gorks" was published featuring characters and creatures from Dracco Heads.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The next year the game was redesigned by Bryan C. Gannon and renamed "Chaotic: Now or Never!" This version of the card game had many characters and cards on which the current version of the Chaotic game and the television series are based.
turn.9: Did any other games come with the game?
turn.10: Dracco Heads was a kids' collectors' product sold by Dracco Company Ltd. Dracco Heads featured little plastic figures shaped like heads of strange creatures.
turn.11: What were some of the Dracco Heads?
turn.12: A few of these Dracco Heads were given both names and purposes for game play.
